sen.j: 畠山 持国（はたけやま もちくに、応永5年（1398年） - 享徳4年3月26日 (旧暦)（1455年4月12日））は、室町時代の室町幕府の管領。
sen.e: Mochikuni HATAKEYAMA (1398-April 12, 1455) was the Kanrei of the Muromachi shogunate of the Muromachi period.
Mochikuni HATAKEYAMA (1398-April 12, 1455) was a Kanrei (Shogun's deputy) of the Muromachi shogunate during the Muromachi period.
Mochikuni HATAKEYAMA (1398-April 12, 1455) was a Kanrei (Shogun's deputy) of the Muromachi shogunate during the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 河内国・紀伊国・越中国の守護。
sen.e: The shugo (constable) of Kawachi no kuni, Kii no kuni, and Ecchu no kuni.
sen.cmt: 守護→shugo (constable) [英語で読む日本史 講談社]
sen.e: He was also the shugo (constable) of the provinces of Kawachi no kuni, Kii no kuni, and Ecchu no kuni.
He was also the shugo (constable) of the provinces of Kawachi no kuni, Kii no kuni, and Ecchu no kuni.

sen.j: 畠山満家の子。
sen.e: Son of Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA.
He was the son of Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA.
He was the son of Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA.

sen.j: 官位は従四位下左衛門督。
sen.e: Official rank of Jushiige Saemon no kami.
He held the official rank of Jushiige Saemon no kami.
He held the official rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Saemon no kami.

sen.j: 後に従三位昇叙。
sen.e: Later became Jusanmi.
He later rose to the rank of Jusanmi rank.

sen.e: He later rose to the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: 出家して徳本（とくほん）と号す。
sen.e: His title became Tokuhon when he entered a Buddhist monastery.
On becoming a buddhist monk, he took the name Tokuhon
On becoming a buddhist priest, he took the name Tokuhon

sen.j: 三管四職家のうち、主に足利義満の時代に取り立てられ勢力を躍進させたのは赤松氏、一色氏、そして持国の畠山氏であったが、義満時代に有力な守護大名であった斯波氏や山名氏が弱体化すると、上の三家が将軍権力の障害となるようになった。
sen.e: Once the powerful SHIBA and YAMANA Families during Yoshimitsu Ashikaga's time weakened, AKAMATSU, ISSHIKI, and Mochikuni's HATAKEYAMA Families of Sankanshishiki Family greatly increased their powers and became an obstacle for shogun authorities.

The AKAMATSU, ISSHIKI, and Mochikuni's HATAKEYAMA families benefited from Shogun Ashikaga Yoshimitsu's rule, increasing their strength and influence but, as the powerful SHIBA and YAMANA families weakened, these three families increasingly became an obstacle for the shogun authorities.

The AKAMATSU, ISSHIKI, and Mochikuni's HATAKEYAMA Clans benefited from Shogun Ashikaga Yoshimitsu's rule, increasing their strength and influence but, as the powerful SHIBA and YAMANA Clans weakened, these three Clans increasingly became an obstacle for the shogun authorities.

sen.j: 特に三管領の一角を占める畠山氏は幕政の中核をしめ、代々の将軍にとって目の上のたんこぶであった。
sen.e: Especially HATAKEYAMA Family of three families formed the core of shogunate and was a constant nuisance for shoguns of different generations.
Of the three, the HATAKEYAMA family, especially, formed the core of the shogunate and was a constant nuisance for generations of shoguns.
Of the three, the HATAKEYAMA Clan, especially, formed the core of the shogunate and was a constant nuisance for generations of shoguns.

sen.j: 六代将軍足利義教は畠山満家の死後、「万人恐怖」と評される恐怖政治を敷き、特に上記三家に対する干渉を強めるようになった。
sen.e: When Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA passed away, the sixth shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA formed so called 'Bannin Kyofu (Ten Thousand People Horror)' government filled with terror to strongly interfere with the three families mentioned above.

When Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA died, the sixth Shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, began a rule of terror, the so called 'Bannin Kyofu (Ten Thousand People Horror,)' mainly to increase pressure on the three families.
sen.cmt: passed away'→'died''government filled with terror'→'began a rule of terror'7cause conflict in'→'increase pressure on'
sen.e: When Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA died, the sixth Shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, began a rule of terror, the so called 'Bannin Kyofu (Ten Thousand People Horror,)' mainly to increase pressure on the three families.

sen.j: 1427年には赤松満祐が討伐され、1440年には一色義貫が殺害されている。
sen.e: Mitsusuke AKAMATSU was suppressed in 1427, and Yoshitsura ISSHIKI was assassinated in 1440.
Mitsusuke AKAMATSU was defeated in 1427, and Yoshitsura ISSHIKI was assassinated in 1440.
Mitsusuke AKAMATSU was defeated in 1427, and Yoshitsura ISSHIKI was assassinated in 1440.

sen.j: 1441年には、義教の矛先は畠山氏に向けられ、持国は家督を弟畠山持永に譲らされ隠居を余儀なくされる。
sen.e: Yoshinori began attacking HATAKEYAMA Family in 1441 and Mochikuni was forced to hand over the family estate to his younger brother, Mochinaga HATAKEYAMA to retire.
Yoshinori began attacking the HATAKEYAMA family in 1441 and Mochikuni was forced to step down and hand over the family estate to his younger brother, Mochinaga HATAKEYAMA.
Yoshinori began attacking the HATAKEYAMA Clan in 1441 and Mochikuni was forced to step down and hand over the family estate to his younger brother, Mochinaga HATAKEYAMA.

sen.j: しかし、持国以上に義教の行動に恐怖を覚えた満祐が、1441年(嘉吉元)に将軍義教を暗殺する事件が勃発する（嘉吉の変）。
sen.e: However, Mitsuie, who feared Yoshinori's behavior more than Mochikuni, assassinated Shogun Yoshinori in 1441 (the Kakitsu Disturbance).
However, Mitsusuke was affected by Yoshinori's policies more than Mochikuni and assassinated the Shogun in 1441 in what is known as the Kakitsu Disturbance.
sen.cmt: Corrected 'Mitsuie' to Mitsusuke'Changed translation of first clause ― not an exact translation but is closer to the intent of the original.Deleted 'Yoshinori'
sen.e: However, Mitsusuke was affected by Yoshinori's policies more than Mochikuni and assassinated the Shogun in 1441 in what is known as the Kakitsu Incident.
sen.cmt: 用語DBに合わせてKakitsu Incidentとしました。

sen.j: 持国はただちに挙兵して持永を討ち、さらに大和に勢力を扶植して管領の細川持之と対立する。
sen.e: Mochikuni immediately raised an army to raid Mochinaga and planted more power in Yamato to oppose the head of the estate, Mochiyuki HOSOKAWA.
Mochikuni immediately raised an army to attack Mochinaga and established a power base in Yamato to oppose the Kanrei, Mochiyuki HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: raid'→'attack''planted more power'→'established a power base'
sen.e: Mochikuni immediately raised an army to attack Mochinaga and established a power base in Yamato to oppose the Kanrei, Mochiyuki HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 7代将軍に義教嫡子の足利義勝が就任し、赤松氏が討伐されると持之は管領を辞任し、持国が管領となる。
sen.e: Mochiyuki resigned from the head of the state and was replaced by Mochikuni once Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, the son of Yoshinori, became the 7th shogun and defeated AKAMATSU Family.
With Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, the son of Yoshinori, becoming the 7th shogun and the AKAMATSU family defeated, Mochiyuki stepped down from the Kanrei position and was replaced by Mochikuni.
With Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, the son of Yoshinori, becoming the 7th shogun and the AKAMATSU Clan defeated, Mochiyuki stepped down from the Kanrei position and was replaced by Mochikuni.

sen.j: 同年、出家し徳本入道と名乗る。
sen.e: In the same year, he entered Buddhist monastery and called himself as Tokuhon nyudo.
The same year, he entered a Buddhist monastery and took the name Nyudo TOKUHON.
The same year, he entered a Buddhist monastery and took the name Tokuhon nyudo.
sen.cmt: Nyudo TOKUHON→Tokuhon nyudoに戻しました。

sen.j: 1443年(嘉吉3)に義勝が病死すると足利義政の将軍就任に運動する。
sen.e: Once Yoshikatsu died of illness in 1443, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA began a political campaign to become the next shogun.
After Yoshikatsu died of illness in 1443, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA began a political campaign to become the next shogun.
After Yoshikatsu died of illness in 1443, he began a political campaign for Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA to become the next shogun.
sen.cmt: 持国が義政のために運動した。

sen.j: 持国には実子が無く、弟の畠山持富を後継としていたが、その後に実子の畠山義就が誕生し、持富を廃しこれを後継とするも、
sen.e: Mochikuni did not sire a child and assigned his younger brother Mochitomi HATAYAMA as the successor but assassinated him upon the birth of his son Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA to make him as the heir.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: While Mochikuni was still childless he had named his younger brother, Mochitomi HATAYAMA, as his successor but with the birth of his son, Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA, he assassinated his brother and made his son the heir.

While Mochikuni was still childless he had named his younger brother, Mochitomi HATAKEYAMA, as his successor but with the birth of his son, Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA, he excluded his brother and made his son the heir.
sen.cmt: 別に持富は暗殺されていません。スペルミス修正。

sen.j: 一部の家臣の反対に遭いこれを断念、あらたに持富の子の畠山政久を後継者とする。
sen.e: However, he abandoned the plan once he was faced with oppositions from some of his vassals and assigned Mochitomi's son, Masanaga HATAKEYAMA (Yasaburo) as the successor.

sen.e: However, he was forced to abandon the plan in the face of opposition from some of his vassals and named Mochitomi's son, Masanaga HATAKEYAMA (Yasaburo) as his successor.

sen.e: However, he was forced to abandon the plan in the face of opposition from some of his vassals and named Mochitomi's son, Masanaga HATAKEYAMA (Yasaburo) as his successor.

sen.j: しかし、家臣団は既に弥三郎派と義就派に分裂しており、ついには義就派の遊佐氏が弥三郎派の神保氏の屋敷を襲撃する事件が1454年に勃発し、血で血を洗う内紛が始まることになる。
sen.e: However, his vassals were already divided into Yoshinari and Yasaburo Parties, and Yoshinaru Party's YUSA Family attacked the home of JINBO Family of Yasaburo Party in 1454, triggering the beginning of internal conflict filled with bloodsheds.

However, his vassals had split into pro-Yoshinari and pro-Yasaburo factions and, in 1454, the pro-Yoshinaru YUSA family attacked the home of the pro-Yasaburo JINBO family, triggering the beginning of a bloody internal conflict..

However, his vassals had split into pro-Yoshinari and pro-Yasaburo factions and, in 1454, the pro-Yoshinari YUSA Clan attacked the home of the pro-Yasaburo JINBO Clan, triggering the beginning of a bloody internal conflict..

sen.j: 当初は義就派が優勢であったが、畠山氏の弱体化を狙う細川勝元と山名宗全により弥三郎派が盛り返し、一進一退の攻防が続く。
sen.e: Yoshinari Party had an upper hand at the beginning, but Yasaburo Party, recovered by Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and Sozen YAMANA (seeking to weaken HATAKEYAMA Family), retaliated, continuing a fierce battle.

At first the pro-Yoshinari faction had the upper hand, but the pro-Yasaburo faction, aided by Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and Sozen YAMANA (seeking to weaken the HATAKEYAMA family), rallied, continuing the fierce struggle.

At first the pro-Yoshinari faction had the upper hand, but the pro-Yasaburo faction, aided by Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and Sozen YAMANA (seeking to weaken the HATAKEYAMA Clan), rallied, continuing the fierce struggle.

sen.j: この騒動の中、持国は病身でもあったため、騒動を抑えきることができないまま1455年に死去する。
sen.e: Since Mochikuni was ill during this turmoil, he passed away in 1455, being unable to suppress the disorder.
In 1455, Mochikuni died from illness, having been unable to end the fighting.
In 1455, Mochikuni died from illness, having been unable to end the fighting.

sen.j: 享年58。
sen.e: He died at the age of 58.
He died at the age of 58.

sen.j: この畠山氏の抗争は、義就と弥三郎の弟の畠山政長が主体となりその後も継続し、足利将軍家や斯波氏の家督相続問題（武衛騒動）と関係して応仁の乱が発生する。
sen.e: This HATAKEYAMA Family turmoil was mainly led by Yoshinari and Yasaburo's younger brother Masanaga HATAKEYAMA and continued to involve ASHIKAGA Shogun family and Shiba Family's successor conflict (Buei Sodo) to lead up to the Onin War.

sen.e: The HATAKEYAMA family feud was continued by Yoshinari and Yasaburo's younger brother, Masanaga HATAKEYAMA and, together with the war of succession between the ASHIKAGA Shogun family and the Shiba (Buei Sodo), led to the start of the Onin War.
sen.cmt: Family turmoil was mainly led by'→'family feud was continued by' continued to involve 'ASHIKAGA Shogun family and Shiba Family's successor conflict (Buei Sodo) to lead up to'→', together with the war of succession between the ASHIKAGA Shogun family and the Shiba (Buei Sodo), led to the start of'
sen.e: The HATAKEYAMA Clan feud was continued by Yoshinari and Yasaburo's younger brother, Masanaga HATAKEYAMA and, together with the war of succession between the ASHIKAGA Shogun family and the Shiba (the Buei Disturbance), led to the start of the Onin War.
